title: Kai'sa has Abilities in her Kit and they do Damage it is so Broken

replies.body: she looks like vayne but with counterplay in mind

ADC LIKE VAYNE?! COUNTERPLAY?!

##BLASPHEMY!!!

Yeah. She has to build stuff to get most of her damage, she can't ult unless she's dealt damage, and even though her w doesn't seem all that fast she still has two weeks on the PBE. Her abilities look like they can be worked around and her Q has strategic potential. She seems like she can be played against.

She can use her ultimate if an ally hits an enemy with an immobilizing crowd control effect. I think she'd actually be a fairly solid jungler. Q may be able to clear camps well and she can follow up on allied CC really well and has execute damage.

Ah, whoops, thanks for correcting me. Still, that means that she needs to work with her team to get her ult without already being in the fight or sniping the enemy. She seems more team and skill oriented than, say, Vayne (I know I know) who basically just rolls and gets tons of free true damage. I know there's more to Vayne than that, I'm just trying to say that Kai'sa seems like she has more counterplay and strategic options/limitations than other marksmen.

I'm just worried about the mobility creep. How many champs will go in the dumpster because of the flashy new champ? Depends on her numbers of course, but I'm still concerned.

If I may, think of it this way:

As far as we've seen, the ultimate is the _only_ mobility spell on the champion. It's a single, AoE "dash" to someone's location. Beyond that, this champion has no form of dash or flash. She has a speedboost on E but from what we can tell, she can't attack while using it. 

Now compare this to Vayne, who has a 2 second "tumble" as well as an always-on "hunting" MS boost that increases when she ults. Or Ezreal who has a blink on a short CD. Etc etc. I wouldn't say Kai is completely immobile but I would say she's not nearly as mobile as characters you could also take bot lane.

It's called the Zoe effect. People are scared of another Zoe

For me, Zoe decreased the quality of the game. It's just super unfun to play against her.

I think people are overreacting to Zoe's release. Yeah, sure she was overpowered, but there have been way more op releases througout leagues history, and all the unfun that comes with it. Just kinda sad that Riot were so slow at toning her down.

It's not that she's OP, it's that she is completely un-fun to play against. you can dodge 10 paddle stars, but the 11th will result in your death. She can chunk (or straight up one shot you, there are some good LCS clips of this) from literally screens away.

But she is still not the only champion that is completely unfun to play against. There are multiple very old champions that are unfun to play against in almost every situation. Best examples being Pantheon, Teemo and Yasuo. Then some opinionated examples like Jayce, Ornn, Quinn when viable, Vayne, Zyra. 
I'd rather play against Zoe than half of those champs since I can at least try to dodge and shut down Zoe when the other champions just right-click you to death without you being able to do anything.
At least they somewhat feel fair. They don't have this stupid amount of damage being delivered while being absolutely safe.

She has abilities? That's kinda concerning.

Her invisibility isn't even an ultimate, that's my main issue. Everything else is fine but once she presses E, that's going to be hard for people to fight her especially if she's fed. I get that Riot wants to give us exciting, top-notch action like champions to keep us interested but I believe they're overdoing it at this point.

What's wrong with giving us champions that aren't overloaded or simple? I think they nailed it with Reworked {{champion:19}} (not counting the fact he's a little too strong right now in this current patch)
To be fair, WW has two gapclosers that both cannot be stopped, but I see your point.
Compared to the abortion of decent champion design of Zoe this looks ridiculously mild in comparison.

She's gonna have some balance issues. You don't actually play this game with a conscious mind if you can't see that.  

If she's balanced around her passive ability unlocks and thier utility she'll either be useless until that time and spike too hard or not enough, be good until that time and spike into OP, or be mediocre until that time and remain mediocre (which completely negates the design of having the gating in the first place, so I doubt this is a plausible scenario). If her isolated Q does anything more than ok damage and they keep it that way she will end up having to have her passive and or E gutted  because that's for sure where her DPS is gonna come from and her Q will provide too much burst when "evolved".  If they go the other route and keep her passive and E hott and nerf her Q, well, now we just have a new Kog'maw-esq steroid right click Mongo. Her pick potential is gonna be busted with her E and being able to ult off of allies CC. Her only saving grace is that she can get herself killed pretty easily by being stupid, but riot doesn't balance around stupid.

I don't know how she's tuned right now, but she will have some serious balance issues moving forward based on her kit alone, and that's not a huge leap to say that.

She has 4 tilting abilities (only if she stacks a stat against you though).  I think she can be balanced and enjoyable, my only true worry is that one of her three play styles will be to weak, and need buffs.

P.S. if you hate divers, use a champion with a stun or knock up.
